Activity: After any setback, ask 'What can I learn from this?' and 'How can I use this to get stronger?'

Activity: Always ask 'How can I make this work better AND look more beautiful?'

Activity: Ask 'Can I actually control this?' and only spend energy on things where the answer is yes

Activity: Ask 'How can I show love to this person?' even when they're difficult or unkind

Activity: Ask 'How can I use my abilities to help others grow?' in every role you have

Activity: Ask 'How can we move forward together?' instead of 'How can I prove I'm right?'

Activity: Ask 'How does this work?' and 'What if I tried this differently?' about everyday things

Activity: Ask 'How will this affect other people?' and 'What serves the greater good?'

Activity: Ask 'How will this help or hurt humanity?' before making important decisions

Activity: Ask 'Is this moving my mission forward?' rather than 'Will this get me recognition?'

Activity: Ask 'What can I learn from this?' and 'How can this experience help someone else?'

Activity: Ask 'What do I believe is truly right?' and act on it even when others disagree

Activity: Ask 'What do I know is right?' and act on it despite criticism or doubt from others

Activity: Ask 'What do I really believe is right?' and act on it regardless of social pressure

Activity: Ask 'What evidence supports this?' and test ideas through systematic observation

Activity: Ask 'What if I combined this idea with something from a completely different area?'

Activity: Ask 'What if the opposite were true?' and think through problems from scratch

Activity: Ask 'What needs to be done?' and 'How can I do this with the least harm to good people?'

Activity: Ask 'What pain might be causing this person to act this way?' before responding

Activity: Ask 'What would a person of good character do?' and follow through even when it's hard

Activity: Ask 'What would happen if we tried to make this 10x better?' and actually try it

Activity: Ask 'What would healing look like?' instead of 'How can I get them back?'
Benefit: Heals relationships and creates lasting solutions instead of ongoing cycles of conflict

Activity: Ask 'What would the perfect solution look like?' and work backwards

Activity: Ask genuine questions to understand others' perspectives before sharing your own views
Benefit: Learns from others and builds better relationships through genuine understanding

Activity: Ask yourself 'How can I use my abilities to help someone who needs it?' and take action regularly
Benefit: Creates meaning and purpose while making a positive difference in the world

Activity: Before addressing problems, ask 'How can I say this in a way that shows I care about them?'
Benefit: Helps people change and grow by combining truth with safety and encouragement

Activity: Before big decisions, ask 'What would be the most honest and ethical choice here?'
Benefit: Builds strong character and inner peace by aligning actions with deeper values and principles

Activity: Before big decisions, spend time in prayer, meditation, or quiet reflection to seek guidance
Benefit: Makes better choices by connecting with deeper wisdom and purpose beyond just logical thinking

Activity: Before deciding, ask 'What would a person of good character do in this situation?'
Benefit: Builds strong character and self-respect while creating positive impact on others

Activity: Before making important decisions, ask 'How will this affect my community?'
Benefit: Creates stronger communities and movements by putting collective needs above personal interests

Activity: Before speaking or acting, ask 'What is really true here?' and choose truth over comfort

Activity: Before speaking, ask 'What does everyone need to know?' and say it clearly, even if it's hard

Activity: Before speaking, ask 'Will these words help or hurt?' and choose language that uplifts
Benefit: Communicates more effectively and creates positive impact through thoughtful language

Activity: Before starting something new, ask 'How will this actually help me or others?'

Activity: Break big goals into daily tasks and track progress in a dedicated notebook

Activity: Choose one important problem and think about it continuously until clarity emerges

Activity: Choose one way to regularly contribute to your community or help solve problems bigger than yourself

Activity: Decide your core values ahead of time and stick to them even when it costs you something

Activity: Do your best work, then accept whatever happens with grace and look for the lesson

Activity: Do your best, then accept whatever happens with grace and learn from it

Activity: Focus on being undeniably excellent at your work while quietly breaking down barriers

Activity: Focus on long-term progress and celebrate small victories while staying committed to your larger goals

Activity: Focus on progress over perfection and celebrate small steps toward bigger goals

Activity: For any decision, ask 'What will this lead to?' and 'What would happen if we do nothing?'
Benefit: Makes better decisions by seeing patterns and consequences others miss

Activity: Identify what you truly value most and be willing to say no to other things

Activity: In any conflict, ask 'What do we all care about?' and build from there

Activity: Keep a learning notebook and practice your most important skills every single day

Activity: Keep working toward your goal while watching for the right opportunity to make your move

Activity: Listen first to understand their perspective, then share insights that connect to their experience

Activity: Listen first to understand what others really want, then find solutions that work for everyone

Activity: Look for one way each day to help someone without them knowing it was you

Activity: Notice and appreciate simple pleasures like sunshine, good food, or friendly conversation

Activity: Notice when your mind wanders and gently bring attention back to your breath

Activity: Practice expressing your important beliefs clearly and persuasively through speaking and writing

Activity: Read something challenging every day and actively seek out learning opportunities

Activity: Regularly ask 'Do I really need this?' and give away things that don't serve your mission

Activity: Regularly ask 'How can I use what I have to help others?' and take action on the answer

Activity: Regularly read, watch, or listen to perspectives from different cultures and backgrounds than your own
Benefit: Makes better decisions and builds better relationships by understanding diverse viewpoints

Activity: Remember that every answer reveals new questions to explore and understand
Benefit: Stays curious and keeps learning instead of thinking you already know everything

Activity: Remind yourself 'I deserve respect' and behave in ways that honor your own dignity
Benefit: Builds inner strength and commands respect by demonstrating your inherent worth

Activity: Remind yourself of your values and keep taking small steps forward every day
Benefit: Achieves lasting change by staying committed to principles over time rather than giving up

Activity: Say 'I don't know, but I'd like to learn' when you encounter something unfamiliar

Activity: Set high standards for yourself and work consistently toward them regardless of others' opinions

Activity: Share something real about your challenges when others are facing similar difficulties

Activity: Start with fundamentals, document everything, and build knowledge brick by brick

Activity: Stay polite and respectful while clearly stating your position and refusing to compromise your values

Activity: Take ideas from one area and ask 'How might this apply to something completely different?'

Activity: Take three deep breaths and ask 'What are the facts here?' before responding

Activity: Think ahead about challenges you might face and prepare your response in advance

Activity: Try small experiments to test important ideas before making major commitments

Activity: Visualize problems as mental movies and play with impossible scenarios to find insights

Activity: When facing a challenge, ask 'Has anything like this happened before?' and learn from it

Activity: When facing a choice, ask 'Which option will make me stronger?' and choose that one

Activity: When facing a moral choice, ask 'What's the right thing to do?' and do it regardless of cost

Activity: When facing an important issue, ask 'What do I believe is right?' and act on it despite opposition

Activity: When facing defeat, ask 'What would happen if we don't keep fighting?' and find one more way to try

Activity: When facing disagreement, ask 'What do we both care about?' and start building from there

Activity: When facing problems, ask 'What would this look like if it was working perfectly?' and share that vision

Activity: When facing unfairness, ask 'How can I resist this wrong without becoming wrong myself?'

Activity: When making decisions, ask 'What am I willing to give up to make this right?'

Activity: When mistreated, ask 'How can I respond in a way that maintains my dignity and their humanity?'

Activity: When progress seems slow, ask 'What small step can I take today?' and trust that small steps add up

Activity: When someone claims something important, ask 'What evidence supports this?' and 'How do you know?'

Activity: When someone faces a challenge you've overcome, share what you learned and how you grew

Activity: When someone hurts you, pray for them or wish them well instead of plotting payback

Activity: When you see injustice, ask 'What needs to be said?' and find a way to say it respectfully but firmly

Activity: When you see something wrong, ask 'What small action can I take?' and do it with dignity

Activity: When you see unfairness, ask 'How can this be made more fair?' and take action to fix it

Activity: When you see unfairness, ask 'What would happen if everyone stayed quiet?' then speak up

Activity: Work steadily on important problems, testing and refining until the solution is complete
